title: Provides that the maximum deductible allowed on policies for windstorms shall not be greater than $1,500
summary: Provides that the maximum deductible allowed in catastrophic windstorms shall not be greater than fifteen hundred dollars and shall be stated in the policy in numerical terms; also provides that deductibles shall only be applicable to losses incurred in windstorms with speeds greater than 125 miles per hour.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to windstorm insurance notice regarding deductibles
